Indeed, because of apparent stagnation in the invention of useful drugs, leaders in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries have argued that poor predictability of animal testing is among the chief challenges facing the drug discovery community.
40 The stresses induced in the laboratory can affect animals' physiology and perturb study results.
41, 42 This begs the question: How relevant is animal testing for predicting human health outcomes?
43, 44, 45, 46, 47, 48 Researchers need to develop human-based testing methods to better identify and predict the safety and efficacy of potential pharmaceutics.
